str2: A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Accusative Feminine Singular
str2: From en and histemi; to place on hand, i.e. impend, be instant.
From ana and the base of agkale; constraint; by implication, distress.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: From nomos; properly, to do by law, i.e. To accustom; by extension, to deem or regard.
To begin, am, exist, be in possession. From hupo and archomai; to begin under, i.e. Come into existence; expletively, to exist (verb).
Properly, beautiful, but chiefly good, i.e. Valuable or virtuous.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Thus, so, in this manner. Or (referring to what precedes or follows).
